snippet: A “constitutional dispute” between President Hassan Sheik Mohamud and Prime Minister Abdi Farah Shirdon resulted in a no-confidence vote.
abstract: Somalia's Parliament votes Prime Min Abdi Farah Shirdon out of office in no-confidence motion, with 184 of 249 lawmakers in favor, after what was termed 'constitutional dispute' between Pres Hassan Sheik Mohamud and the prime minister.
lead_paragraph: A “constitutional dispute” between President Hassan Sheik Mohamud and Prime Minister Abdi Farah Shirdon resulted in a no-confidence vote.

headline.main: Parliament in Somalia Votes to Remove Prime Minister
headline.print_headline: Parliament in Somalia Votes to Remove Prime Minister
